newsitem.title: ISRAEL: U.S. complains to Israel over Iranian nuts.
newsitem.headline: U.S. complains to Israel over Iranian nuts.

text.p: U.S. pistachio growers are finding the Israeli market hard to crack -- and blame Iranian nuts.
Israel's Industry and Trade Ministry said on Tuesday the United States wants the Jewish state to stop the illegal import, via European countries, of Iranian pistachios.
Iran is officially classified in Israel as an enemy state and import of products from the Islamic republic is forbidden under law.

The issue was raised at a meeting last week in Washington of a joint U.S.-Israeli economic committee after U.S. pistachio growers complained they could not penetrate an Israeli market which they said was saturated with Iranian nuts.
Zohar Peri, head of foreign commerce at the Industry and Trade Ministry, told Reuters that Israeli importers might be falsifying the country of origin on import documents.
"Israeli Customs are looking into the matter and will decide how to act," he said, adding that Israel did not want to give Iran access to its market, especially at the expense of U.S. exporters.
